channel.title: Java live desktop viewer?
channel.description:
I'm curious on how to accomplish this. Im pretty sure it isn't called a live desktop viewer but i've seen it from people before. What happens is that you go to a website, then your prompted for a password, put the correct in and you get access to someones desktop, now obviously the person is letting you view it. And they can keep track of who all views it.
I saw this before. and what i'm trying to explain may be alittle cloudy, but if you get the concept. How did they do this. I've googled multiple times, done research and im still unsure.
All i remember is that it was a client inside of java that you could see their desktop. It lagged pretty bad also. but any help is much appreciated

item.title: Java live desktop viewer?
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

www.logmein.com, like that?

Read full topic

item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Lol, I did the same in my noob days. Lol, sent images via robot ftw =P.
Yay for 2fps =D.

Try googling ‘remote assistance’.
